DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Moraes Filho, José Aguiar;De Aguiar Moraes Filho, José;MORAES FILHO, JOSÉ DE AGUIAR;DE AGUIAR M. FILHO, JOSÉ;Filho, Jose Aguiar

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doctorate from Universitat Kaiserslautern (2010). Has experience in Computer Science, focusing on database, acting on the following subjects: mobile databases, mobile transaction, query processing, and XML data management.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Bacharelado Em Ciência da Computação from Universidade Estadual do Ceará (1987), master's at Computer Science from Universidade de Fortaleza (2003) and doctorate at Informatik (Promotiosprogramm-Doktorandenstudium) from Technische Universität Kaiserslautern (2010). He is currently associate professor at Universidade de Fortaleza. Has experience in Computer Science, focusing on Database, acting on the following subjects: bancos de dados móveis, mobile databases, mobile transaction, agentes móveis and processamento de consultas.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Database Buffer Management Strategies for Asymmetric Media
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Database Buffer Management Strategies for Asymmetric Media

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: For decades, hard disk drives (HDD) have dominated the scene with regard to data storage for large databases systems. HDDs may be considered a symmetric media because there is no difference between the time (and cost) for reading and writing data. As a counterpart, in the last years, a whole new class of storage media has raised, whose the main feature is to have no mechanical parts and, more importantly, to be asymmetric. In a asymmetric media, the time for reading data is faster than the time in which such media writes data. Depending on manufacturing, this asymmetry may reach a factor of 10 or even higher. Asymmetric storage impacts on the most important database management system components, more specifically, on the buffer manager. In this research, we propose database buffer replacement algorithms for asymmetric media. They try to take advantage from the use of a asymmetric media by keeping written (dirty) pages in main memory, postponing their writing down on media and also adapting to achieve good hit ratios.
